Specific Details: Dáil debate on Official Development Assistance (ODA) will take place this Thursday 26 April from 2pm-5pm. The debate will focus on the Joint Committee on Foreign Affairs, Trade and Defence report on the Irish Aid programme
DPOs Lobbied: Pat Buckley|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Kevin O'Keeffe|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Seán Sherlock|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::David Stanton|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Ciarán Cannon|Minister of State for the Diaspora and Overseas Development Aid|Department of Foreign Affairs::Simon Coveney|Tánaiste and Minister|Department of Foreign Affairs
Subject Matter: Dáil debate on Official Development Assistance (ODA) will take place this Thursday 26 April from 2pm-5pm. The debate will focus on the Joint Committee on Foreign Affairs, Trade and Defence report on the Irish Aid programme
Intended Results: To outline the key messages on ODA and the effectiveness of Irish aid funding in overseas programmes. To ensure that the Government puts in place plans to meet our commitment of 0.7% of GDP towards the Overseas Development Aid Budget annually
Lobbying Activities:
Lobbying conducted via Twitter with TD's from Cork East as well as those directly involved with the Department of Foreign Affairs that who have an influence on the Overseas Development Aid budget 

Sample of Messages sent via Twitter
Ireland has a proud history of supporting the world's poorest. We're delighted there is a #Dáil debate today on how best to improve people's lives #IrishAidWorks - Calling on our local TD's to support this debate @patbuckleysfme @davidstantontd @seansherlocktd @kevinokeeffeff
Irish NGOs work in 68 countries, reach over 20 million people, with over 15,000 skilled professionals! #IrishAidWorks @ciarancannon, 
The #JCFATD review of Irish Aid unanimously supported the call for a multiannual plan to reach 0.7%. It’s time to see this plan! #IrishAidWorks @patbuckleysfme @davidstantontd @seansherlocktd @kevinokeeffeff @ciarancannon @simoncoveney @Dochasnetwork|Social Media|11-20

Lobbyist Name: Irish Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children
DPOs Lobbied: Alan Farrell|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Pat Buckley|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Eugene Murphy|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Fintan Warfield|Senator|Seanad::Tom Neville|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Kathleen Funchion|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Catherine Noone|Senator|Seanad
Intended Results: To make recommendations to the members of the Joint Oireachtas Committee to improve mental health service provision for young people in Ireland. Specifically in relation to Listening to children, reducing current waiting lists, Implementation of the Pathfinder project, and Provision of 24 hour adolescent mental health services
Lobbying Activities:
A written submission was sent to the Oireachtas committee and following this we presented to the Committee on the 9th of October 2019.
The ISPCC as the National Child Protection Charity presented its insights into the area of youth mental health which arises from listening to and working directly with children and young people|Submission|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: John Church CEO and Caroline O' Sullivan Director of Services
